Created attachment 8909151
NewTabPage_flicker.mov

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_12_6) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/63.0.3218.0 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce:

macOS 10.12.6
57.0a1 (2017-09-17) (64-Bit)

1.) CMD-N to open a New Tab Page


Actual results:

Gear, Firefox Logo, Search Bar, etc. are flickering


Expected results:

They should not flicker. At least the Gear and the Firefox Logo should not flicker, if you want a blank page. This is disruptive.

comments.raw_text: If we want to fix this, we'll need to improve newtab preloading, and possibly warm up the preloaded new tab so that we are ready to switch to it immediately.
comments.creator: florian@mozilla.com

comments.raw_text: Bug 1417155 will make it possible to have new tabs load about:blank to be entirely blank. As for the flicker, it's what's shown before a new tab is switched to and is mainly noticeable from an existing new tab page.
